title: Public support for welfare and redistributive policies in Ireland

yaml.title: Public support for welfare and redistributive policies in Ireland
yaml.author: Daniel Capistrano, Bertrand Maître and Helen Russell

markdown.markdown:
```{r} library(tidyverse) ``` ## Redistribution ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} [3 in 4]{.giant} Irish residents agree that the *government should reduce differences in income*. ::: ::: {.column} ![](./img/fig_eumap.png) ::: ::: ::: {.aside} Source: Authors’ own analysis of the European Social Survey 2023/2024 ::: ## Taxes [1 in 3]{.giant} Irish residents indicated that they *agree with higher taxes if it means more or better public services*. This is the 6th highest percentage across 27 EU countries. ::: {.aside} Source: Authors’ own analysis of the Eurobarometer Flash Survey 2025. ::: ## Social benefits ::: {.columns} ::: {.column}
More than [half]{.big} of Irish residents agree that *social benefits make people lazy*. ::: ::: {.column} ![](./img/fig_lazy.png) ::: ::: ::: {.aside} Source: Authors’ own analysis of the European Social Survey 2009/2016. ::: ## Relevant events ::: {.columns} ::: {.column}
Those who experienced job loss during the [COVID19]{.big} pandemic are more supportive of redistribution, regardless of their financial situation or social class. ::: ::: {.column} ![](./img/fig_covid.png) ::: ::: ::: {.aside} Source: Authors’ own analysis of the European Social Survey 2023/2024. ::: # Literature {.inverted} ## Societal level influences - Higher support for redistribution in countries with higher inequality [@velev_economic_2024; @finseraas_income_2009] - Support for redistribution remained apparently stable over time [@lupu_unequal_2023] and could be related to lack of major political reaction to income inequality. ## Socio-demographic predictors - Women are more progressive in relation to policy preferences and support for redistribution [@shorrocks_attitudinal_2020; @inglehart_cultural_2018; @grasso_are_2025] - @steele_wealth_2022 find that older respondents are more favourable of income redistribution. - @grasso_are_2025 highlights the association between gender and generation, with the cohorts of women born after 1946 being more supportive of redistribution compared to men in their cohorts ## Welfare for whom? @van_oorschot_social_2017 note that support for welfare policies, social transfers and redistribution is conditional on the social legitimacy of these policies' target groups # Methods {.inverted} ## Data sources - European Social Survey (2002 - 2024) - European Elections Studies (EES) - Electoral Commission / Eurobarometer ## References ::: {#refs} ::: # Results {.inverted} ## Fairness ![](./img/fig_fairness.png) ## Social benefits ![](./img/fig_benefits.png) ## Deservingness ![](./img/fig_deservingness.png) ## Tax ![](./img/fig_taxes.png) ## Redistribution over time (total) ![](./img/fig_eutime.png) ## Redistribution over time (social class) ![](./img/fig_time_class.png) ## Events (DSP campaign) ![](./img/fig_dsp_mean.png) ## Events (Budget) ![](./img/fig_budget_mean.png)
